reviewText: TOPPER IS ONE OF THE BEST TV SERIES OF ANY GENERATION. I CAN NEVER GET ENOUGH OF IT AND HAVE BOUGHT IT FOR OTHER'S TO ENJOY. AND IT IS AS CLEAN AS YOU CAN GET. A GREAT STEP BACK TO A BETTER TIME IN THE 50'S.

I thoroughly enjoy watching the old "Topper" shows again.  They are so entertaining, and so mild (ghost-wise) that even a child could watch them and not have nightmares.  These are really fun, and very nostalgic movies.
Entertaining. From the TV series. Funny. Amusing enough to watch more than once. If you enjoyed the movie version, you will definetly enjoy this also.

Classic old Topper show, difficult to find even on Netflix. The only bad part is the picture quality on this set is about what you'd expect on YouTube or less. Compression artifacts abound, (worse than YouTube in some places) and the contrast is poor. Head switching error at the bottom of the screen. They didn't put much post production time into these DVDs. They needed to be adjusted for contrast and expanded slightly to get rid of the crap on the edges. Still, an historical look into TV around 1953, and that in itself is interesting. Packaging is better than the product inside.
Best movie ever!
wonderful old movie

This is a must have for those that lived thought the era. However I was surprised to see so much smoking. Has society change that much that most of the scenes look like one big cigarette commercial? It is hard to see the ghosts through all the smoke.

Although there is a series of Topper movies, this TV series is the Topper I came to know and love. Once in a while I see the actors in other movies and it reminds me of the character he/she played on this movie. Anne Jeffreys as Marion Kerby, can be seen again in the movie "Boys' Night Out" (1962) Leo G. Carroll as Cosmo Topper, can be seen again as Rev. Dr. Mosby in "The Parent Trap" (1961).

Basic story is that a young fairly modern couple, George and Marion Kerby got caught in an avalanche along with their rescuer St Bernard, Neil. They refused to give up the ghost and went home to live. Turns out that Cosmo toper and his wife Henrietta (Lee Patrick) Bought the Kerby house. Yep now Cosmo can see the Kerby's when they wish and Neil turns out to be a lush. The situation now has its plusses and minuses as everyone becomes one happy family.
i enjoy watching older movies and this is one of them.  the movie line is easy to follow and not as violent as some others.
I was not disappointed!  This is a must have DVD if you too enjoy going back to the days of our youth!  This was just as fun to watch today as it was 50 years ago.
Enjoyed watching it with the family loaned them to my sister for her family to watch and enjoy as we watched them as kids.
This is a classic with a Great Cast!! Picture and sound fair but worth seeing again! If you love the 50's shows you will enjoy!
Enjoyed when first shown on TV.

Topper is a wonderful series. Reminds us of when TV shows were really entertaining, not just marketing nonsense, cheap horror, mindless violence or scatological collegiate humour dumbed own for the masses.

It wasn't the
Topper I was looking for but it's ok for an old show.
I have not complaints .
I bought this for my mom, who use to watch this when she was a young girl.  She says she loves it.

When I was young, I loved this show on Television. I truly thought that the stuff shirt "man" of the house" was very funny and acted the part of Topper very well so when I saw they were available I purchased it. I stil love it. The acting is understated and his reactions to the "spirits" are really quite funny. The supporting cast is excellent, as is the script. This is better then the Cary Grant movie (which is enjoyable, just different). If you saw that you will enjoy this. This is not for everyone however as times have changed and I am not sure that all will see and understand the humour in it however it is well worth a try. The video is old however I found the series to be fine to watch.

Todays writers have a lot to learn from the veteran writers
of long ago.  Today's humor is rude, and insulting. If it wasn't
for "canned laughter" no one would laugh.
I was very disappointed with this purchase.  The quality was very bad & very hard to watch.  I tried to contact the sellers, but received no response.
I love the Topper movies! They are so funny! Good, clean comedy! Try to find that in movie making in this day and age?

I did get this movie on time, but the picture and audio quality were poor.
I donated it to my local Goodwill.

These episodes were of course TOP NOTCH, but I was so dissappointed that there were only four episiodes per DVD.  Somehow I thought these were complete seasons.  Any baby boomer who remembers sneaking into the living room late at night (with her big sister, while their mother slept innocently unknowing) to watch reruns, would be thrilled to get ANY episode.  The episodes themselves get as many stars as there are stars available.  They lose one star for leaving me wanting MORE...
Volume 1 of the set wouldn't play at all. Volume 2 begins with a poor picture but clears up after a short time.
We have looked for the Topper movie the contained the St. Benard dog in the series for years. Found it in the TV series. Delighted, Still funny!

Topper  1 & 2  has very poor quality.  It looks like it never has been restored.  If you like the Topper series buy  THE ADVENTURES OF TOPPER  for  $ 3.99.  It has  9 episodes  and they are very good.

I grew up with watching Topper and although I don't remember the episodes, I remember Leo G. Carroll and Neil the dog. The quality is not as sharp as the movies out today, but for the age of the series, I still enjoyed watching them.  Brings back a lot of memories.

I used to watch this on TV when I was in grade school. I loved it then and love it now. Topper lives with three ghosts: a husband and wife and their Saint Bernard. Unfortunately, Topper is the only one who can see them. I especially like the dog.
Great movies
perennial favorite from my childhood. it feels good to own it. haven't watched it all, as yet--but so far, so good! great memories of simpler times.
